text: hi my name is Mary Nolan I'm here in the
bone Appetit Test Kitchen and my
favorite thing about summer is that it
kind of turns cooking on its head you
get to go outside turn on the grill turn
off the stove and we're gonna be doing
that today with delicious summer sauces
simple and accessible is key because I
know I have two little boys so I can
barely do anything that requires more
than two steps so I like things where I
can grab it out of my pantry a few
things that I have in my spice cabinet
maybe a lemon or a lime
whip it together and it really makes my
dish special the first step is that I'm
gonna be using this eggless spread as
the base of my dip and I usually don't
measure I do this a lot I kind of just
eyeball it next I'm just gonna add some
spices these are all things that you can
find in your pantry a little smoked
paprika some Aleppo pepper and then some
garlic powder sprinkle of salt then a
little lime zest squeeze some lime what
pepper mix it all together
these are great things to serve in a
crudite platter because they're all
things you can find at the supermarket
for example this is beautiful fennel I
love the taste of raw fennel and it's
he's so good in the smoky dip some
cucumbers that I've just sliced in the
diagonal some blanched and shocked green
beans so delicious in the summertime
Yukon Gold potatoes these are one of my
favorites with this dip some breakfast
radishes some grilled bread and these
rainbow carrots they really just kind of
elevate the experience making this
perfect for entertaining so now I'm
gonna be making a Green Goddess dressing
which I really love this because it's
creamy it's Irby I've already picked
some basil and parsley and mint in the
summer my garden has lots of basil lots
of parsley all the good stuff that you
need for making this dressing I love
avocado okay now I'm just gonna put it
into a blender and next I'm gonna add
some of my eggless spread we're gonna
add about 3/4 of a cup
nice poppy seeds I really love this
combination of flavors with the eggless
spread the avocado the herbs it's
perfect for a weeknight dinner on the
porch next I'm gonna be showing you one
of my favorite Bon Appetit recipes for
sesame peanut sauce and I love the sauce
because it's really versatile almost
everything you need you're gonna find in
your pantry and it goes well with so
many things I'm gonna be tossing it with
some silver noodles and then adding some
fresh vegetables but it goes great with
chicken satay a number of things to
start I'm just gonna take some coconut
milk and I'm just gonna put a good
splash in my mixing bowl you can always
add more
next is peanut butter and it's gonna
bring forth that yummy rich peanut
flavor in this dish so I'm just gonna
add a good dollop of that next a little
splash of soy sauce a little dash of
toasted sesame oil a splash of rice
vinegar a little sprinkle of salt I'm
gonna whisk this up and I'm also gonna
add a little squeeze of lime now I'm
ready to add my soba noodles so I'm just
gonna put these right in the bowl toss
them about with my time
so I'm just going to mound this up onto
my platter and then I'm just gonna get
some vegetables ready to go on top as
garnish
finally my peanuts was making me quite
hungry I can't wait to dig in here this
completes the lovely sesame peanut sauce
with soba noodles perfect summer dinner
